title: (x) Fedora Core - Myriad (customized) {Marc O}
content:
Okay, I hate Linux, but I love this font. Anyone?   
   
 ![fedora core](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121092134im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/49090.png)

 [‹ (x) Downtown Dog Lounge - Compacta, Bank Gothic {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121092134/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6712 "Go to previous forum topic") [Microtek Logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121092134/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6705 "Go to next forum topic")
author: anonymous

comments.content: Resembles [Zine Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121092134/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/zine-sans/dis-bold-italic-tf/testdrive.html?s=Fedora&p=72). Not quite an exact match, though. Also resembles Fago.
Actually, I think it's Myriad Bold Italic, with an angled terminal added to the top of the d, and middle arm of the F raised.
Nice work Marc! Sometimes the answers are right in front of our noses. That "a" should have tipped me off.
Sorry, but just to clarify, it is indeed Myriad Bold Italic?

QED is short for "quod erat demonstrandum," which in Latin means "which was to be demonstrated."   
   
It's the only thing I remember from high school trigonometry. ;)   
Our teacher would write it on the board after he had shown us how to solve some equation.

Easier to remember in Spanish:   
   
"Que Es lo que quer
